dfischer.utils

Class HttpLoadTestSingleString

  • java.lang.Object
    • dfischer.utils.HttpLoadTestSingleString

  • public class HttpLoadTestSingleString
extends java.lang.Object
    Checks if a string fragment occurs within a string (content).

    Additional of searching the occurrence of a simple string, the following special search patterns are also supported:

    • ![<search text>] means that the search text must not occur inside the content.
    • #<int>[<search text>] means that the search text occurs exactly <int> times inside the content.
    • #<int>-[<search text>] means that the search text occurs at minimum <int> times inside the content.
    • #<int1>-<int2>[<search text>] means that the search text occurs at minimum <int1> times but not more than <int2> times inside the content.
     
    Search String Examples:
    helloThe search text "hello" must occur at least one time inside the content
    ![ORA-01652]The search text "ORA-01652" must not occur inside the content
    #1[Dear Mr.]The search text "Dear Mr." must occur exactly one time inside the content
    #1-2[Order Number]The search text "Order Number" must occur at minimum one time and at maximum two times inside the content
    #3-[new order]The search text "new order" must occur at minimum three times inside the content
